description: Returns a description of specified virtual tapes in the virtual tape shelf (VTS). This operation is only supported in the tape gateway type. If a specific TapeARN is not specified, Storage Gateway returns a description of all virtual tapes found in the VTS associated with your account.

parameters.name: TapeARNs
parameters.description: Specifies one or more unique Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) that represent the virtual tapes you want to describe. (string) ---

nested_items.name: TapeArchives
nested_items.description: An array of virtual tape objects in the virtual tape shelf (VTS). The description includes of the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tapes. The information returned includes the Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the tapes, size of the tapes, status of the tapes, progress of the description, and tape barcode.

nested_items.name: TapeARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an archived virtual tape.

nested_items.name: TapeBarcode
nested_items.description: The barcode that identifies the archived virtual tape.

nested_items.name: TapeCreatedDate
nested_items.description: The date the virtual tape was created.

nested_items.name: TapeSizeInBytes
nested_items.description: The size, in bytes, of the archived virtual tape.

nested_items.name: CompletionTime
nested_items.description: The time that the archiving of the virtual tape was completed.

nested_items.name: RetrievedTo
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the tape gateway that the virtual tape is being retrieved to.

nested_items.name: TapeStatus
nested_items.description: The current state of the archived virtual tape.

nested_items.name: TapeUsedInBytes
nested_items.description: The size, in bytes, of data stored on the virtual tape.

nested_items.name: KMSKey
nested_items.description: Optional. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does not support asymmetric CMKs. This value must be set if KMSEncrypted is true, or if EncryptionType is SseKms or DsseKms.

nested_items.name: PoolId
nested_items.description: The ID of the pool that was used to archive the tape. The tapes in this pool are archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with the pool.

nested_items.name: Worm
nested_items.description: Set to true if the archived tape is stored as write-once-read-many (WORM).

nested_items.name: RetentionStartDate
nested_items.description: If the archived tape is subject to tape retention lock, the date that the archived tape started being retained.

nested_items.name: PoolEntryDate
nested_items.description: The time that the tape entered the custom tape pool.

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: An opaque string that indicates the position at which the virtual tapes that were fetched for description ended. Use this marker in your next request to fetch the next set of virtual tapes in the virtual tape shelf (VTS). If there are no more virtual tapes to describe, this field does not appear in the response.
